title: Civil Supplies Minister Nadendla Manohar orders seizure of fair price shop at AP Bhavan in Delhi
content: In a surprise check, he finds irregularities in weighing rice bags and sizeable quantity of broken grains in the rice

title: Over 300 dengue cases reported in Ernakulam since March 1
content: A spike in dengue cases has been reported in areas under the Kochi Corporation and the Thrikkakara and Kalamassery municipalities

title: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu performs ‘bhoomi puja’ for new house in Amaravati
content: It is being built on a plot Naidu purchased from farmers in the core capital area; women farmers from the capital region decorate the site with traditional rangoli patterns

title: Tamil Nadu police warn of potential risks in generating Ghibli art online
content: Many websites offering free downloads of Ghibli art are often fronts for malicious cyber activities, say police

title: World’s largest fuel-efficient container ship MSC Turkiye calls at Vizhinjam
content: The ship that berthed at the port at 5.10 p.m. will leave for Ghana on Thursday evening after discharging around 2,000 TEUs containers

title: Two suffer minor burns following short circuit in Jalibenchi village
content: A high voltage 11 kV live electricity cable came in contact with a LT live power line due to gusty winds resulting in the short circuit

title: JSP leaders offer prayers for quick recovery of Pawan Kalyan’s son Mark Shankar
content: Pawan Kalyan’s son Mark Shankar condition is stable said Jana Sena Party Etcherla In-charge S. Vishwaksen

title: Chittoor MP reiterates his vision to develop SC/ST colonies
content: Social welfare, infrastructure, and agricultural advancement are high on the agenda, says Daggumalla Prasada Rao appealing to the local leaders to identify the problem areas in their respective regions

title: Govt. yet to decide on constitution of State Waqf Board per new Central legislation
content: The Telangana government is likely to take a decision on the Board’s constitution after deliberations, even as Muslim groups gear up to launch protests against the Act

title: Kerala and Tamil Nadu to conduct joint Nilgiri Tahr census from April 24-27
content: The synchronised survey of the mountain ungulate is being conducted to commemorate the 50th anniversary of the establishment of Eravikulam National Park

title: Battery Energy Storage System: KSEB to ink MoU with solar energy corporation on April 10
content: BESS unit will be used to store cheap and surplus energy produced during the daytime, when demand is low, for use when the demand is high, especially the evening hours

title: Congress must have a positive narrative, not just negative criticism: Shashi Tharoor
content: Mr. Tharoor says young voters are more interested in what the Congress can do for them today and tomorrow, not in hearing about its glorious past; says Congress’s nationalism is inclusive, anchored in social justice

title: Donor’s grandchildren does a U-turn, say Munambam land not a Waqf property
content: They support the argument of Farook College management that the disputed land in Munambam is not a Waqf property. They inform about their stance to the three-member Waqf tribunal through their advocate

title: APUWJ 36th State convention to be held in Ongole in May
content: State-level conferences were held twice in Ongole, during 1987 and 2002, when it was still united Andhra Pradesh, says APUWJ State president

title: Shiv Sena MLA vows to confront Kunal Kamra over ‘traitor’ remark against Shinde
content: Shiv Sena MLA Murji Patel, whose complaint led to an FIR against Kunal Kamra, said that the party would confront the comedian whenever he visits Mumbai next

title: Rival Kerala Congress factions observe K.M. Mani’s sixth death anniversary
content: Jose K. Mani-led KC(M) observes occasion with a ‘K.M. Mani Smriti Sangamam’ at Thirunakkara, while the rival faction led by P.J. Joseph observes the anniversary under the theme ‘Day of the Toiling Class,’ as a tribute to Mani

title: Use AI to check tax evasion, says Chandrababu Naidu
content: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister calls on all departments to work towards achieving the State’s own revenue target of ₹1,37,412 crore for this financial year

title: Over 2% of drug samples tested from Kerala’s medical stores in 2024 were of poor quality, reveals RTI query
content: The Drugs Control department in Kerala checked 5,578 random samples from medical shops across the State in 2024. RTI filed by Anil Kumar, convener, CAPSULE Kerala, a wing of the Kerala Sasthra Sahitya Parishad

title: Delhi HC reserves order on pleas over errors in CLAT UG-2025 questionnaire
content: On February 6, the Supreme Court transferred all the petitions over the issue to the Delhi High Court for a “consistent adjudication”

title: Terminal capacity utilisation of airports in Kerala lowest in country
content: 57% of the combined terminal capacity of the four airports is unutilised. The airports have a combined terminal capacity to handle 45.1 million passengers a year. However, the passenger footfall was 19.27 million in 2023-24

title: Allocate more beds, prevent strangers in Old GGH in Vijayawada, say Andhra Pradesh SCPCR members
content: Commission Chairperson K. Appa Rao questioned on why two mothers and babies were accommodated on one bed

title: Sankara Narayanan: a life haunted by tragedy and thirst for vengeance
content: Nearly 23 years after he confronted his daughter’s killer, an act that earned him a heroic status in the eyes of countless parents who feared for their daughters’ safety, the tragedy haunted Sankara Narayanan for the rest of his life until he died at the age of 75.

title: AIUDF is the BJP’s B-team, says Raijor Dal chief Akhil Gogoi
content: The two parties have been cooperating covertly in communal politics in Assam, activist turned MLA said

title: People of 50 villages and Kavali town suffering due to incomplete flyover bridge, says MLA
content: Dagumati Venkata Krishna Reddy urges R&B Minister B.C. Janardhana Reddy to construct a railway underpass in place of the flyover

title: Indian banks win U.K. bankruptcy appeal in Vijay Mallya case
content: Mallya remains on bail in the U.K. while a “confidential” legal matter believed to be related to an asylum application is resolved in connection with the unrelated extradition proceedings

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: 2020 Delhi riots: Court stays till April 21 order for further probe against Kapil Mishra
content: The court also issued notice to complainant Mohammad Ilyas, on whose plea the magistrate ordered the FIR, and asked him to respond by April 21

title: Writer-director Muhsin Parari on his latest song, ‘Areela’
content: ‘Areela’, sung by actor Indrans and produced by DJ Sekhar, explores the quiet ignorance that exists between beings who share the same world

title: Nirmala Sitharaman chairs India-U.K. investors meeting, highlights India's investment opportunities
content: “India offers a compelling growth opportunity for foreign banks and the government of India is actively encouraging foreign investment in the banking sector,” Ms. Sitharaman said

title: Gritty students from migrant labour camp in Shivamogga studied under street lights to clear II PU exams with good score
content: Geetha and Ganesh belong to tribal communities in which students making the transition to higher education is uncommon even today

title: Cabinet approves ₹1,878-cr Zirakpur Bypass road project in Punjab, Haryana
content: Union Cabinet approves construction of 6-lane Zirakpur Bypass to ease congestion in Punjab and Haryana, costing ₹1,878.31 crore

title: Kumari Ananthan’s long political career marked by his association with Kamaraj
content: Born in Agatheesvaram of Kanniyakumari district on March 19, 1933, Mr. Ananthan, who held double post-graduate degrees in political science and Tamil, began his career as an associate of Kamaraj and joined the Congress party in 1954

title: Cabinet approves irrigation scheme for ‘modernising’ water management
content: The key goal of the M-CADWM is to modernise the irrigation water supply network, ensuring that irrigation water reaches the designated farming clusters from existing canals or other water sources

title: Kerala Chief Secretary Sarada Muraleedharan to hear suspended IAS officer N. Prasanth on April 16
content: In his defence statement given to Kerala government in February, Prasanth sought a hearing that is digitally recorded and streamed live. Reportedly, the request has been granted

title: Heatwave onslaught in large parts of India
content: A searing heatwave swept through many states of central and western India on Tuesday, April 8, with temperatures soaring to a scorching 46.4 degrees Celsius in Rajasthan’s Barmer

title: Justice Sanjeev Kumar appointed as acting Chief Justice of Jammu & Kashmir High Court
content: On April 4, 2025, the Supreme Court Collegium recommended the appointment of Justice Arun Palli as the Chief Justice of the High Court of Jammu & Kashmir and Ladakh

title: Supreme Court to hear pleas over ₹50 lakh cap on Centre aid for rare diseases
content: The Supreme Court will review petitions challenging the ₹50 lakh cap on government assistance for treating rare diseases, including spinal muscular atrophy. The case will be heard by a bench headed by Justice P S Narasimha starting May 13

title: No rift in alliance with BJP in Karnataka, says H.D. Kumaraswamy
content: He said JD(S) is not joining the Janakrosha Yatre of the BJP, as it is an exercise to strengthen their party

title: BSF jawan injured in IED blast in Punjab on Pakistan border
content: While sanitising the area, the detonating device of the IEDs, which was concealed, accidentally got triggered, resulting in a serious leg injury to the jawan

title: Belagavi-Mysuru flight emergency landing: Aircraft handling by crew was a factor in incident, says DGCA report
content: DGCA report states that the probable cause of the incident was failure to manage the aircraft vertical path and improper Crew Resource Management performance

title: Nearly three months after attack on Saif Ali Khan, Bandra police file charge sheet in Mumbai court
content: “The charge sheet consists of evidence against the accused Bangldeshi national  Mohammad Shariful Islam,” an official said without elaborating

title: Saidai Duraisamy urges AIADMK to follow M.G.R. and Jayalalithaa’s approach of political reconciliation
content: Mr. Duraisamy told journalists that both M.G.R. and Jayalalithaa had taken under their fold those leaders who were once extremely critical of them

title: Drunk Flyer Pees On Co-Passenger On Air India's Delhi-Bangkok Flight
content: An Indian national allegedly urinated on a fellow passenger in a Delhi-Bangkok Air India flight today, sources said.

title: China Raises Tariffs On US Goods To 84% After Trump's 104% Move
content: China had accused the US of 'arrogant and bullying behaviour' after Trump's 104 per cent tariffs took effect.

title: "India, China Relationship Is...": Beijing's Message After Trump's 104% Tariff
content: Donald Trump's tariffs are doing, it appears, what decades of political and diplomatic wrangling could not, at least with any great degree of success - to get India and China to work together.

title: India Bringing Tahawwur Rana, What Was His Role In 26/11 Attacks
content: Tahawwur Rana, accused of plotting the 26/11 terror attacks in Mumbai, is likely to be presented before a Delhi court after he is brought back from the US.

title: "You Have Grandchildren?": Top Court's Deadline For Packaged Food Labels
content: The Supreme Court has set a three-month deadline for the Centre to implement food safety norms that make it mandatory to display key information about packaged food items on containers. Hearing a Public Interest Litigation, the bench of Justice JB Pa

title: "Kissing My A**, Trying To Make Deals": Trump On Countries Hit By Tariffs
content: US President Donald Trump mocked tariff-hit nations on Tuesday (local time), stating that they were ready to don anything while trying to negotiate with him.

title: Fugitive Businessman Vijay Mallya Loses Appeal Against UK Bankruptcy Order
content: Indian tycoon Vijay Mallya on Wednesday lost an appeal against a bankruptcy order made by London's High Court over a more than 1 billion-pound ($1.28 billion) debt to lenders including the State Bank of India.

title: 10 Days Before Daughter's Wedding, UP Woman Elopes With Would-Be Son-In-Law
content: Shivani was supposed to get married in 10 days. The invitations were printed and relatives had been invited. Then came a twist that left Shivani and her entire family stunned - her mother eloped with her would-be groom.

title: Union Minister Jitan Manjhi's Granddaughter Shot Dead By Husband In Bihar
content: Union Minister Jitan Ram Manjhi's granddaughter was shot dead allegedly by her husband in Bihar's Gaya on Wednesday, police said.

title: US Woman Travels To This Indian Village To Marry Her Instagram Friend
content: A US woman has travelled thousands of miles to marry the love of her life - a man who comes from a remote village in Andhra Pradesh.

title: 3 Lakh Indian Students Face Uncertainty As US Bill Plans End Of Work Visa
content: Indian students are the largest beneficiaries of the OPT program, with 97,556 participants in the 2023-2024 academic year, a 41% increase from the previous year.

title: "Your Idol Is 'Girgit'": Navjot Sidhu, Ambati Rayudu In Ugly Spat On TV
content: Ambati Rayudu and Navjot Singh Sidhu had a clash on Live TV during the Punjab Kings vs Chennai Super Kings match in IPL 2025.

title: "Only When We Summon...": Top Court On Emergency Aid In Road Accident Cases
content: The Supreme Court on Wednesday reprimanded the centre for failing to implement a cashless medical treatment plan that includes access to emergency aid during the 'golden hour' for road accident survivors.

title: Opposition Alleges Chittaranjan Park Fish Sellers Threatened, BJP Says "False"
content: A popular fish market in south Delhi's posh Chittaranjan Park neighbourhood is at the Centre of a massive political row after a viral video showed some people objecting to the sale of fish next to a temple and saying this was hurting their sentiments

title: India Gets Taste Of Satellite-Based Internet During Myanmar Quake Ops
content: India tried its first real-time use of satellite-based Internet during New Delhi's Operation Brahma - providing aid to the quake-hit residents of Myanmar.

title: India engaged with U.S. to seal trade pact: EAM Jaishankar
content: India aims to firm up a bilateral trade pact with the U.S. amid Trump’s tariffs, says External Affairs Minister Jaishankar

title: Jammu and Kashmir Mirwaiz claims Muslim body not allowed to hold meeting over Waqf issue
content: Authorities prevent MMU meeting at Mirwaiz’s residence to discuss Waqf Bill, sealing off access to religious representatives from J&K

title: No loan waiver for Wayanad landslides victims; only rescheduling, restructuring: Centre tells Kerala HC
content: The Centre made this submission in an affidavit filed in response to High Court's query on whether the loans availed of by the affected individuals could be waived

title: Delhi Minister Kapil Mishra moves court against order for further probe against him in 2020 riots case
content: The court is also likely to take up for hearing an application filed by Delhi Police against the order of further investigation

title: Robbers cut open ATM in Kalaburagi, steal ₹18 lakh
content: The ATM was loaded with cash around 6 p.m. on April 8, and the robbery took place the following morning

title: No rooms for solo pilgrims visiting Raghavendra Swamy Mutt in Mantralayam
content: Though it is not a newly-introduced rule, many people who travel to the pilgrim town are unaware of the rule

title: A farming collective in Thiruvananthapuram to launch a festival to attract the vacation crowd
content: Ooranvila Krishikoottam to open a 20-day festival on April 10 showcasing millet festival, flower show, aqua show, pet show, and entertainment activities

title: Siddhu Jonnalagadda interview: The humour in ‘Jack’ will not dilute its crux
content: As ‘Jack’ gears up for release, actor Siddhu Jonnalagadda discusses his career post the Tillu films, the funny guy image, and his writing process

title: FIR filed against 11 Congress leaders, 5,000 unnamed party workers for March 27 agitation
content: The Congress had organised the 'Vidhan Sabha Gherao' programme on March 27, 2025 in protest against the "rise in atrocities" against women and girls

title: Telangana’s support to tourism ventures to be presented at South Asia Hotel Investment Conference
content: Telangana Govt aims to attract investments worth ₹15,000 crore in the tourism sector: Jupally Krishna Rao

title: Cabinet Committee on Security approves $7-billion deal to procure 26 Rafale Marine jets from France
content: The deal worth over $7 billion is expected to be signed when the French Defence Minister visits India later this month

title: Raitha Sangha to hold regular santhes in Bengaluru to facilitate farmer-to-consumer direct sale in Karnataka
content: The first such santhe will held at Munivenkatayya Memorial Open Air Theatre in Rajarajeshwarinagar from April 12 to 14

title: MP meets railway officers to review projects in Belagavi district of Karnataka
content: Jagadish Shettar, Lok Sabha member and former Chief Minister, said that he had received several complaints that the design of the newly-constructed road-under-bridge near the level crossing at Sulebavi village is unscientific

title: Kerala Motor Vehicle Inspector’s roadside mridangam jam with motorcycle rider goes viral
content: Impromptu performance was done along Kottayam-Kozhencherry road after a Motor Vehicles Department team stopped a motorcycle for traffic violation. The pillion rider, a musician, turned out to be the official’s friend

title: India Gets Taste Of Satellite-Based Internet During Myanmar Quake Ops
content: India tried its first real-time use of satellite-based Internet during New Delhi's Operation Brahma - providing aid to the quake-hit residents of Myanmar.

title: Ex-MLBers Dotel, Blanco die in nightclub tragedy
content: Former major leaguers Octavio Dotel and Tony Blanco were among the more than 110 people who died after the roof of a nightclub collapsed in the Dominican Republic early Tuesday.

title: Luka: Was trash-talking fan, not ref, when ejected
content: Luka Doncic says he was trash-talking with a courtside fan in the fourth quarter of the Lakers' loss to the Thunder when an official thought Doncic's ire was directed at him, leading to an ejection for the Lakers guard.

title: Auburn's Freeze 'at peace' with cancer diagnosis
content: As he plans out his third season on the Auburn sidelines, Tigers coach Hugh Freeze, 55, told ESPN's Chris Low this week that he is "at peace" with his cancer diagnosis, and now, following a 5-7 season, "we've got to go compete and win some more games."

title: Grizz's Wells awake, alert but has broken wrist
content: Grizzlies rookie Jaylen Wells is awake, alert and moving his extremities but sustained a broken wrist after a scary fall against the Hornets.

title: Skenes ships career-worst 5 runs in loss to Cards
content: Paul Skenes might still be relatively new in the major leagues, but the Pittsburgh Pirates star isn't new to baseball and he won't be sweating a shaky start Tuesday night in which he gave up a career-worst five runs to the St. Louis Cardinals.

title: Jets C Lucius, 21, retires with tissue disorder
content: Chaz Lucius, a 21-year-old center and former first-round pick for the Winnipeg Jets who played this season for the Manitoba Moose of the AHL, announced his retirement on Tuesday due to a hereditary tissue disorder called Ehlers-Danlos syndrome.

title: Comeback Canucks make history with furious finish
content: In a stunning 6-5 overtime victory Tuesday over the Dallas Stars, the Vancouver Canucks, still chasing a playoff spot in the Western Conference, made NHL history, becoming the first team to overcome a three-goal deficit in the final minute of regulation.

title: Cavs wrap up East's top seed, 'hungry for more'
content: Darius Garland scored 28 points, and the Cavaliers clinched the top seed in the Eastern Conference with a 135-113 win over the Chicago Bulls on Tuesday night.

title: Masters storylines to follow: From which LIV golfers can contend to newcomers to watch
content: Can Scottie Scheffler win for the third time in four years? How will LIV golfers fare? We look at five storylines to watch this week at the Masters.

title: Efficient scorer, versatile defender: How Paige Bueckers' game will translate to the WNBA
content: Only Caitlin Clark and Sue Bird have averaged 10 PPG and 5.0 APG as WNBA rookies, a group Bueckers should aspire to join.

title: Our hottest early MLB hot takes: From a Cy Young trifecta to an MVP candidate you've never heard of
content: What can we glean from two weeks of baseball? Enough to make our experts go all-in on their boldest predictions.

title: How has the torpedo bat changed the industry?
content: The torpedo bat's rise has changed the industry for the companies that make them. Here is one bat-maker's story.

title: What's next for Denver after firing Michael Malone? NBA insiders debate the Nuggets' shocking move
content: The Nuggets stunned the league by moving on from their coach and GM. Why now? Where does Denver go from here? NBA insiders weigh in.

title: From Lobo's 1995 champs to Bueckers' 2025 crown: Ranking all 12 UConn title teams
content: Paige Bueckers helped UConn win its 12th NCAA championship, and first since 2016. Where does this title rank?

title: The USWNT doesn't have a No. 1 goalkeeper, putting a longtime position of strength in doubt
content: After years of Alyssa Naeher and Hope Solo dominating, the USWNT is without a clear-cut starting goalkeeper, and no obvious No. 1 has emerged in auditions.

title: Arsenal secure a Champions League win for the ages as Real Madrid hope for Bernabéu magic
content: This was Arsenal's finest hour in Champions League history, and it's hard to believe even Real Madrid can wage a comeback in the quarterfinal's return leg.

title: Cam Ward, Shedeur Sanders and the shared weakness that could make or break their NFL careers
content: Hanging on to the ball too long is a tough habit to break. Can the NFL draft's top QBs get their throws out quicker in the pros?

title: 'A big swing-and-miss': Has Deshaun Watson played his last down in the NFL?
content: Browns owner Jimmy Haslam admitted for the first time last week that the 2022 trade for Watson was a failure. What's next for Cleveland and its QB?

title: R.C. Slocum is the 'last one of those guys'
content: It will be a long time before another figure spends half a century working for a program the way that Slocum did at Texas A&M.

title: 'Violence. Lots of violence': What to expect in Patricio Pitbull's UFC debut
content: One of the best fighters to never have competed in the UFC -- until now -- looks to prove himself at UFC 314.

title: 'I just have a good feel about the place': A decade later, can Jordan Spieth do it again?
content: Ten years ago, Jordan Spieth rushed through his lone coronation at the Masters. He still believes he can get another shot.

title: 2025-26 men’s college basketball rankings: Way-Too-Early Top 25
content: Florida captured the national title Monday night, but Houston is already the favorite at the top for next season.

title: USWNT stunned by Brazil's late goal in 2-1 loss
content: Brazil edged out the U.S. women's national team with a 2-1 victory on Tuesday in a hard-fought friendly in San Jose, California.

title: Rice: Set-piece coach said cross; Saka said hit it
content: Declan Rice revealed the role Bukayo Saka played in his first freekick against Real Madrid on Tuesday, saying his Arsenal teammate encouraged him to "go for it" despite set-piece coach Nicolas Jover telling him to cross.

title: Højlund: UEL not a 'rescue'; Utd 'early' in rebuild
content: Manchester United striker Rasmus Højlund said he does not like the narrative that a Europa League triumph would "rescue" the club's difficult season.

title: Bellingham: Madrid 'lucky' to concede only 3 goals
content: Jude Bellingham admitted Real Madrid were "lucky" to only concede three goals in their 3-0 Champions League quarterfinal first leg defeat to Arsenal on Tuesday.

title: Courtois: 'I take responsibility' for Rice free kick
content: Goalkeeper Thibaut Courtois said he "takes responsibility" for Declan Rice's stunning opening free kick goal in Real Madrid's 3-0 Champions League quarterfinal first leg defeat to Arsenal on Tuesday.

title: Premier League seals 5th place in 2025-26 UCL
content: The Premier League will have five teams in the Champions League next season after it secured one of the extra places for performance by its clubs.

title: Matic on Man United spell: Trophies weren't focus
content: Former Manchester United midfielder Nemanja Matic has said the club was not as focused on "winning" as their rivals during his five-year spell at Old Trafford.

title: Galaxy struggles continue as Tigres end cup run
content: Tigres held off a rally from the LA Galaxy to win 3-2 on Tuesday night in their Concacaf Champions Cup quarterfinal second leg and advance to the semifinals.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Zirkzee to aid Man United's Ndoye move?
content: Manchester United are ready to make a €30m move to sign Bologna winger Dan Ndoye. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Which team takes the top spot after Week 9?
content: How far did the Gators fall? Which teams rose the most? Check out our updated college softball Top 25 poll, plus players to watch.

title: Bullpen stock watch: Surprise closer in Texas
content: Everything fantasy baseball managers need to know about which closers should be added, dropped, and more.

title: MMA divisional rankings: Lerone Murphy still undefeated, no longer unranked at featherweight
content: Here's a look at every weight class to determine the best of the best in UFC, Bellator, PFL and beyond.

title: 'Pee-gate' 2.0: Flyer urinates on co-passenger aboard Air India flight
content: A business class passenger on Air India’s Delhi-Bangkok flight urinated on a co-passenger before landing on April 9, 2025. Air India confirmed the incident and said the crew followed procedures. The victim declined to file a complaint, and an internal panel will decide on further action. This follows a similar incident in 2022.

title: Walmart boycott: World's largest retailer tells protesters, 'we are America's ...'
content: Walmart is facing a week-long boycott, "Walmart Blackout," led by People’s Union USA over DEI rollbacks and tax concerns. While Walmart defends its community contributions and tax payments, critics argue the DEI changes undermine workplace diversity. Data suggests Walmart is more resilient to boycotts than Target, which faced significant backlash for similar initiatives.

title: Viral Clip: Preity Zinta spotted with new IPL hero Priyansh Arya
content: Preity Zinta shared a heartfelt moment with Priyansh Arya after his explosive 103 off 42 balls helped Punjab Kings defeat CSK. The 24-year-old’s knock, featuring seven 4s and nine 6s, made him the second-fastest Indian centurion in IPL history. Zinta’s joyful celebration and Arya’s rise have since gone viral, marking a star’s arrival.

title: 'Sometimes our best is not good enough': SRK's heartfelt message to KKR
content: After a narrow four-run loss to Lucknow Super Giants, KKR shared a heartfelt message from team owner Shah Rukh Khan. In his note, SRK praised the team’s fight, urged them to move on with heads held high, and reminded them that heartbreak can bring a team closer. The message has gone viral.

title: 40-yr-old woman elopes with would-be son-in-law days before wedding
content: In a shocking turn of events, a 40-year-old woman from Aligarh eloped with her daughter's 20-year-old fiancé just days before their wedding. The couple allegedly absconded with Rs 2.5 lakh in cash and jewellery, prompting a police investigation. Authorities are currently searching for the duo, with suspicions pointing towards Uttarakhand as a possible hideout.

title: The making of six-hitting Priyansh Arya: A Gambhir touch!
content: Priyansh Arya, who was the top-scorer for Delhi in last year’s Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy with 222 runs at the strike rate of 166.91, grabbed eyeballs in the inaugural Delhi Premier League. Playing for South Delhi Superstarz, Arya slammed 608 runs in 10 innings with a whopping strike rate of 198.69, with two centuries and four fifty-plus total.

title: Indian-American engineer Vaniya Agrawal shares resignation email she sent to CEO Satya Nadella and staff after disrupting Microsoft’s 50th anniversary event
content: Vaniya Agrawal, an Indian-American software engineer, resigned from Microsoft after protesting the company's alleged role in providing AI technology to Israel's military. She disrupted Microsoft's 50th-anniversary celebration, accusing the company of enabling violence in Gaza. Agrawal cited a $133 million contract with Israel's Ministry of Defense and urged employees to sign the "No Azure for Apartheid" petition before being dismissed.

title: 'Rana should be hanged': Father of cop killed in 26/11 terror attacks
content: Tahawwur Rana is being extradited after the US Supreme Court rejected his plea seeking extradition to India.

title: Watch: Virat Kohli's heartwarming gesture for a little fan at Wankhede
content: A heartwarming video of Virat Kohli signing an autograph for a young fan went viral after RCB’s 12-run win over Mumbai Indians at Wankhede. The touching gesture came as Bengaluru broke a 10-year losing streak at the venue, with Kohli leading the charge with a 67-run knock.

title: Jaya Bachchan calls Abhishek-Shweta achievement, Hania Aamir supports Apoorva Mukhija and more
content: Today's top entertainment highlights include Jaya Bachchan proudly calling her children her biggest achievement, RJ Mahvash sparking dating rumours with Yuzvendra Chahal, and Bollywood mourning producer Salim Akhtar. Also making headlines: Suchitra Krishnamoorthi opens up about Shah Rukh Khan, and Hania Aamir supports Apoorva Mukhija amid online threats after a recent controversy.

title: The heart of a champion: Alex Ovechkin’s parents, Mikhail & Tatyana Ovechkina
content: Alexander Ovechkin, the Washington Capitals' captain, has surpassed Wayne Gretzky's long-standing record of 894 NHL goals, now standing at 895. Ovechkin's parents, Tatyana and Mikhail, have been his unwavering support system. Tatyana, a former Soviet basketball star with two Olympic gold medals and a World Championship, has been a constant presence at his games.

title: ‘Death by China': How Peter Navarro shaped Trump's trade war and Beijing tariff
content: More than a decade after Death by China, Peter Navarro’s once-marginal warnings are shaping US policy. The 104% tariff on Chinese EVs echoes his thesis: China’s rise is a strategic threat. Critics warn of global disruption, but Navarro’s ideas now resonate worldwide, fueling economic nationalism and redefining trade debates in an era of geopolitical and technological rivalry.

title: 'Using it out of frustration': Kaif questions 'retired out' tactic in IPL
content: Mohammad Kaif criticised the rising use of the 'retired out' tactic in IPL 2025, calling it an act of frustration. His remarks followed CSK’s decision to retire out Devon Conway on 69 during a steep chase against Punjab Kings — a move that failed as CSK lost by 18 runs.

title: How room full of GMs put an end to FIDE vs Freestyle Chess row
content: Viswanathan Anand's withdrawal from the Freestyle Chess Grand Slam in Germany dealt a major blow to hopes of reconciliation between FIDE and Freestyle Chess. Tensions escalated after a dress code dispute involving Magnus Carlsen, with Anand enforcing FIDE rules. Despite backchannel talks, Freestyle players ultimately chose to crown their own “Freestyle Chess Champion,” sidelining FIDE’s authority.

title: 'Unilateralist and protectionist acts': China releases White Paper on tariff
content: The US-China tariff war escalated sharply, with the US imposing 104% tariffs and China retaliating with 34%. Amid rising tensions, China released a White Paper condemning US protectionism and unilateralism, warning of economic instability and disrupted global trade. It calls for equal dialogue and multilateral cooperation to resolve differences and maintain global economic order and stability.

title: SC pulls up Centre for missing deadline on cashless medical treatment scheme
content: The Supreme Court sharply criticised the Centre on Wednesday for delaying the implementation of a cashless treatment scheme for motor accident victims. Citing a breach of its January 8 order, the court summoned the transport ministry secretary to explain the delay. The court emphasised that financial hold-ups cost lives, and warned of contempt proceedings. The scheme, mandated under the Motor Vehicles Act, was to ensure critical care during the ‘golden hour’ post-accidents.

title: Is it official? Chahal shares photo with Mahvash amid relationship talks
content: Yuzvendra Chahal has sparked relationship rumours after sharing a photo with RJ Mahvash on Instagram, following his split from Dhanashree Verma. Mahvash, seen supporting Punjab Kings at an IPL match, posted a heartfelt message for Chahal. Chahal responded warmly, praising her support. Their social media exchange has caught fans’ attention and stirred speculation.

title: Gretzky’s wife gifts $280k ring to Ovechkin’s wife after record goal
content: Alex Ovechkin's historic 895th goal, surpassing Wayne Gretzky's record, was celebrated with a unique tradition. Janet Gretzky gifted Anastasia Shubskaya, Ovechkin's wife, an eight-carat diamond ring, continuing a custom started by Colleen Howe. Despite the Capitals' loss to the Islanders, the focus remained on Ovechkin's legacy and the enduring bond between hockey families as the Capitals head into the playoffs.

title: Explained: What's the difference between 'Retired Hurt' and 'Retired Out'?
content: In a rare tactical move during Indian Premier League 2025, CSK retired out Devon Conway on 69 in the 18th over vs Punjab Kings. Replaced by Jadeja, the decision aimed to boost the chase but failed. It marked the season’s second such instance, sparking debate on “retired out” vs “retired hurt.”

title: ‘Speak Marathi, not English’: Woman with baby thrashed for saying 'excuse me'
content: In Dombivli, a dispute erupted when Poonam Gupta greeted her neighbors in English, leading to a violent altercation. The Dhoble family allegedly assaulted Gupta, her friend, and her husband after taking offense to the language. Initially, police filed a non-cognizable complaint, but after CCTV footage surfaced showing the Dhobles' aggression, they are reconsidering.

title: 'I haven't seen many better knocks': Ponting lauds Arya's attitude
content: Priyansh Arya’s blazing 103 off 42 balls powered Punjab Kings to a vital 18-run win over Chennai Super Kings. More than his record-equaling ton, it was his fearless comeback after a first-ball duck that earned high praise from coach Ricky Ponting, epitomising the team’s fighting spirit and attitude.

title: Florida Gators wins it all, yet 7’9” freshman Olivier Rioux becomes unexpected hero
content: Olivier Rioux, the 7'9" Canadian redshirt freshman, is generating excitement at the University of Florida despite not yet playing. Recognized by Guinness World Records, Rioux's towering presence and training at IMG Academy have made him a fan favorite. As the Gators celebrate their national championship, anticipation builds for Rioux's debut and potential impact on college basketball and beyond.

title: After 15-year wait to seek revenge, sons lynch dad's killer with sticks in UP
content: In a chilling act of revenge, Mahawat, recently released after serving 15 years for murdering Rampal, was lynched in broad daylight in Hardoi. A mob led by Rampal's sons, Rahul and Beeru, avenged their father's death, mirroring the original crime by beating Mahawat to death with sticks.

title: Google is paying top AI techies to do… absolutely nothing? Here's why
content: In a surprising move, Google is paying top AI employees—especially from DeepMind—to do nothing, using noncompete and "garden leave" agreements to prevent them from joining rivals. While the company claims it’s a strategy to protect innovation, critics call it career-stunting and abusive. As the AI race heats up, Google’s golden cage approach is sparking serious debate.

title: Sikh high priests declare ‘religious emergency’ in Punjab
content: Citing a "religious emergency" in Punjab, the five Sikh high priests have instructed all Sikh preachers to return to the state. They are tasked with adopting 10 villages each for intensive religious preaching over the next four months.

title: Renukaswamy murder case: Actor Darshan skips court hearing citing backache
content: Actor Darshan, accused in the S Renukaswamy murder case, missed Tuesday's court hearing, citing a backache and ongoing filming for his movie, Devil. While his girlfriend Pavithra Gowda and other co-accused appeared, Darshan's advocate filed for exemption and requested the release of seized mobile phones.

title: Jaya Bachchan calls Abhishek and Shweta her greatest achievement - Exclusive
content: Jaya Bachchan is celebrating her 77th birthday and in an exclusive conversation with us, she shared reflections on her illustrious career and motherhood. She considers her children, Abhishek and Shweta, her greatest achievements. Throughout her diverse film career, she has played various roles but particularly enjoyed her portrayal of a villain in the movie 'Rocky Aur Rani Kii Prem Kahaani.'

title: Patient follows doctor and seeks consultation while he was jogging: This is what the doc did
content: The life of a doctor in India is a demanding blend of dedication, pressure, and purpose. From grueling years of education to relentless hospital shifts, the journey is one of constant sacrifice. Many doctors clock in long hours, especially in overcrowded public hospitals, often with scarce resources.  Dr. Sudhir Kumar’s recent social media post highlights the often-overlooked importance of self-care among doctors.

title: 20 years of King Charles-Camilla's marriage: When Harry, William begged him not to remarry
content: King Charles III and Queen Camilla are celebrating their 20th wedding anniversary with new portraits taken in Rome during their state visit to Italy.

title: Govt clears mega Rs 64,000cr deal to buy 26 Rafale-Marine jets from France
content: India's Cabinet Committee on Security has approved a nearly Rs 64,000 crore deal with France for 26 Rafale-Marine fighter jets for INS Vikrant. The agreement includes 22 single-seat and four twin-seat trainers, along with weapons and support. Delivery is expected within 37 to 65 months.

title: How much will your loan EMIs come down with repo rate cut? Explained
content: RBI has given loan borrowers reason to cheer with two back-to-back repo rate cuts in this calendar year. This is likely to translate into lower EMIs in the coming months. We explain the math:

title: Waqf Act: SP moves SC against new law, says 'discriminates against Muslims'
content: The Samajwadi Party has filed a writ petition in the Supreme Court challenging the Waqf Amendment Bill, 2025, joining over 10 other petitioners, including Congress, AIMIM, and Jamiat Ulama-i-Hind. They argue the Act discriminates against Muslims. The Centre has submitted a caveat seeking to be heard. Hearings are expected around April 15.

title: 'Been harshly treated by more than 1 man': Kayla Nicole clarifies Kelce wasn’t the only
content: Kayla Nicole is opening up about the emotional challenges she faced while dating high-profile men, including Travis Kelce, revealing the toxic dynamics and public scrutiny that took a toll on her. She emphasizes the importance of prioritizing self-love and setting boundaries after experiencing harsh treatment and online harassment. Now, Kayla is choosing privacy and emotional safety in her relationships.

title: Kerala madrassa teacher gets 187 years in jail for sex assault
content: Mohammed Rafi, a madrasa teacher, received a 187-year prison sentence. A special court in Taliparamba delivered the verdict. He was convicted of sexually assaulting a 16-year-old student. The abuse occurred repeatedly during the Covid-19 lockdown. Rafi also received a fine of Rs 9.10 lakh. He was previously convicted of similar crimes. The police registered a case following the girl's revelation.

title: India open to zero duty on imports from US in PLI
content: India is considering zero-duty imports from the US across various sectors, including those under the PLI scheme, to expedite a bilateral trade agreement and reverse reciprocal tariffs. This offer is contingent on strict rules of origin, requiring 30-40% value addition.

title: 'Terrible experience': Ex-WHO chief slams Air India; airline responds
content: Former ICMR chief Soumya Swaminathan has publicly criticized Air India, labeling her experience as "terrible." Despite her loyalty and sufficient mileage, she was unable to upgrade her Nairobi to Delhi flight. Swaminathan expressed frustration over the illogical reasons provided by the airline. Air India responded, requesting her booking details to investigate.

title: 'I am not Sanjay of Mahabharata': RBI governor on Trump tariff impact
content: Amidst global economic uncertainties fueled by trade tariffs, the RBI has cut the repo rate to 6.5% and adopted an accommodative stance, signaling a potential for further rate reductions. While aiming for growth-supportive monetary policy, the RBI acknowledges challenges and revised downwards GDP growth projections for FY 2025-26 to 6.5%.

title: Luka Doncic is 'still adapting' two months after trade to Lakers
content: LUKA DONCIC PULLED his '68 Camaro into the American Airlines Center parking garage . he sported a black, western cut button-down shirt with a bolo tie, some Wrangler jeans and even a pair of Lucchese boots . it was a big day for the Dallas Mavericks, who were hosting leBron James and the los Angeles Lakers .

title: Stanley Cup playoff watch: Matchups to monitor Wednesday
content: playoff and draft lottery ramifications aplenty, so let's hit all five matchups rapid-fire . a win over the Flyers would be a good step toward climbing back into the playoffs . the flyers are fourth in the draft lottery order heading into this matchup .

title: How does the F1 championship look heading into the Bahrain GP?
content: Max Verstappen has caught up to Lando Norris in the drivers' championship . the forecast is hot and sunny with daytime highs of 36°C from Friday through to Sunday . nighttime temperatures are expected to drop to around 22°C .

title: Inter's Martínez and Thuram could be Inzaghi's X factors in the Champions League
content: Inter beat Bayern Munich 2-1 in their UEFA Champions League quarterfinal first leg . a striker partnership was more than evident at the Allianz Arena on Tuesday night . the two strikers combined brilliantly on the first goal, with Thuram's sugar sweet layoff .

title: NBA Power Rankings: Where all 30 teams stack up at the end of the regular season
content: the 2024-25 NBA regular season wraps up Sunday but all eyes will be on Wednesday's clash between the los Angeles Lakers and the Dallas Mavericks . the Sacramento Kings host the Denver Nuggets (ESPN, 10:30 p.m. ET), who'll be taking the court for the first time since Tuesday's firing of an NBA coach . top playoff contenders such as the Cleveland Cavaliers are aiming to lock up their postseason spots .

title: Hurt Over Rs 2-3 Crore Loss, Mary Kom Leaves Husband Onler: Report
content: the trouble in the couple's paradise is said to have started after Mary's husband, Karung Onkholer . the couple had spent Rs 2-3 crores while campaigning, but the defeat in the elections left the two shattered . onler, on the other hand, is in Delhi .
